column4: hi, for some reason 64-bit version 10.04 of ubuntu won't load any wireless drivers right after install so i can't connect to the internet
but i can't get to it at the moment
you probably need b43 for that device would be my guess
10.xx, you can probably install the STA driver if you follow the instructin son that page(w/o internet access)
u still have the 64bit live cd?
system/admin/synaptic   click settings/repositories  then on the first tab, check "CD" at the bottom.. close it.. and click reload   you'll get a bunch of errors, but don't worry about it.
then use synaptic, and install those packages one at a time in the order they are on the walkthrough there.
do they have no alternative method?.. and why do you need to flash it?
are you sure a bios update fixes it?
